intro: Anodendron laeve, commonly known as the smooth anodendron, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and leaves that are often elliptical or lance-shaped. Its flowers are typically clustered in umbels and are usually yellow or greenish in color. Anodendron laeve is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it adapts well to dry conditions.
